metadata.feature_description: Option to hide the Windows authentication login button from the login page

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Extensions > Authentication Systems > DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication > Site Settings
steps.expected: Site Settings tab should load with Hide Login Controls checkbox
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Site Settings tab. Hide Login Controls? checkbox is visible and accessible

steps.action: Check the Hide Login Controls? checkbox and click Update Authentication Settings
steps.actual: Checkbox was already checked. Clicked Update Authentication Settings - settings saved (LDAP status messages displayed, expected since no real AD server)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Windows Login Button Hidden on Login Page

steps.action: Log out and navigate to the login page
steps.expected: Windows Login tab should be hidden when Hide Login Controls is enabled
steps.actual: Windows Login tab is still visible on the login page alongside the Standard tab, even with Hide Login Controls? enabled

issues: The Windows Login tab remains visible on the login page despite the Hide Login Controls? setting being enabled
The feature does not function as expected - the setting can be toggled but has no effect on the login page UI

observations: The Hide Login Controls? checkbox is present in the AD authentication settings and can be toggled
The setting saves successfully (confirmed by page refresh showing checked state)
Code review shows chkHidden.Checked maps to config.HideWindowsLogin property stored as AD_HideWindowsLogin setting
The login page component may not be reading or applying the HideWindowsLogin setting to control tab visibility
Both Standard and Windows Login tabs appear identically regardless of the Hide Login Controls setting value
